body:
Do people even use the Forums that much?

I only see on a daily base average from like 5-10 people max.

There is also a problem with Viewers and Repliers. I really don't like.
body_tagged:

title: Online Users

replies.body: The most I've seen is 30 online, but at one point there was 3
replies.body_tagged: The most I've seen is 30 online, but at one point there was 3

replies.body: During the day it will be low because people are at school or work. Views and replies is accurate...
replies.body_tagged: During the day it will be low because people are at school or work. Views and replies is accurate...

replies.body: I never saw under 12. soulreaper u dont play avicus 6 months, and u are only in forums. wth
replies.body_tagged: I never saw under 12. soulreaper u dont play avicus 6 months, and u are only in forums. wth

replies.body:
Would the Viewer number still go up for people who aren't signed in?

Like for example I know when you sign out people can still go to "Forums" and enter a discussion.

This to me just feels like an evasion of privacy on the website. Funky have ever thought of making so when people click on "Forum" a page would come up "Sorry you haven't registered to teh Avicus Network Yet. To view the Forums please join our Network and Sign Up."

I'm just concerned because I notice a thread could either have up to 68 Viewers but only 12 Replies. It really makes no sense. I mean even for popular threads which I saw was by EpicZombie had reach over 4K Views but however only had like around [maybe] 600-700 replies.

Anyways thanks for the reply. :)

replies.body:
Viewer number is the number of users logged in viewing the forums... You can count to find that out :P

What's wrong with 68 views and 12 replies? 68 users have viewed it, some have viewed it multiple times, and 12 users have replied... If you view a discussion, you aren't required to reply to it.

replies.body:
Oh. Sometimes the Viewer amount is so much higher then the Replies, I just thought it counts people who aren't logged in and it counts them.

Sorry if I'm wrong.

However I still don't like the fact people can read discussions when they aren't even signed in.
